ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Have you seen him who prevents
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Have you seen him who restrains
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did you see him who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Have you seen the one who prohibits
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: What is your opinion – regarding him who forbids –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have you seen him who prevents
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you seen him who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What thinkest thou? He who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou seen him who dissuadeth
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you seen one who prevents
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Have you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) seen him (i.e. Abu Jahl) who prevents,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What do you think? Have you seen he who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you seen him who prevents?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have you seen the one who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:9] Have you seen (a-ra’ayta in all three instances [here and below] is an exclamation of wonder) him, namely, Abū Jahl, who forbids
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Then it was revealed about Abu Jahl Ibn Hisham when he wanted to step on the neck of the Prophet (pbuh) while he was in prayer: (Hast thou seen him) Muhammad (who dissuadeth
